testprocedure.test-case-summary: This test procedure is called by a test case and is used to verify the SUTs support of the dlRouteStatusUpdate dialog as an OC using variables provided by the calling test case. This procedure supports verification of requirements related to user need 2.3.5.2.3 [Need to Share Route State] and is used for both valid and invalid test cases.

testStep.functionId: Step 1 CONFIGURE: Determine the Application Layer Standard that will be used for this test. RECORD this information as: ApplicationLayerStandard: ${ApplicationLayerStandard}

Step 2 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Restrictions is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.4.2.5.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N16R342_Restrictions_Supported = ${TMDD_N16R342_Restrictions_Supported}

Step 3 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Route Name is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.4.2.5.2.2). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N16R343_Route_Name_Supported = ${TMDD_N16R343_Route_Name_Supported}

Step 4 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Route Detour Status Flag is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.4.2.5.2.3). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N16R344_Route_Detour_Status_Flag_Supported = ${TMDD_N16R344_Route_Detour_Status_Flag_Supported}
Step 5 CONFIGURE: Determine the number of publication message transmissions that will be received within this test. RECORD this information as: PublicationsToReceive: ${PublicationsToReceive}
Step 6 CONFIGURE: Determine whether an error response message is expected for this test. RECORD this information as: PublicationErrorResponseExpected: ${PublicationErrorResponseExpected}

Step 7 CONFIGURE: IF PublicationErrorResponseExpected is true, determine the expected error code response for this test. RECORD this information as: PublicationErrorTypeExpected: ${PublicationErrorTypeExpected}
Step 8 CONFIGURE: Define the publication response message that will be sent to the SUT. RECORD this information as: PublicationResponseMessage: ${PublicationResponseMessage}
Step 9 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the Authentication parameters need to be verified within this test. RECORD this information as: AuthenticationCheck: ${AuthenticationCheck}
Step 10 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SUT will be allowed access to the information requested in this test. RECORD this information as: AllowAccess: ${AllowAccess}
Step 11 CONFIGURE: Define the publication message that will be sent to the SUT. RECORD this information as: SubscriptionMessage: ${SubscriptionMessage}
Step 12 CONFIGURE: Determine whether an error response message is expected for this test. RECORD this information as: SubscriptionErrorResponseExpected: ${SubscriptionErrorResponseExpected}

Step 13 CONFIGURE: IF SubscriptionErrorResponseExpected is true, determine the expected error code response for this test. RECORD this information as: SubscriptionErrorTypeExpected: ${SubscriptionErrorTypeExpected}

Step 14 SUBSCRIPTION-EC with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlTrafficNetworkInformationSubscription SUBSCRIPTIONMESSAGE = SubscriptionMessage SUBSCRIPTIONERRORRESPONSEEXPECTED = SubscriptionErrorResponseExpected SUBSCRIPTIONERRORTYPEEXPECTED = SubscriptionErrorTypeExpected Returns: CONTINUEPUBLICATION
Step 15 IF SubscriptionErrorResponseExpected is not equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 15.1 WHILE CONTINUEPUBLICATION is equal to TRUE then CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.

Step 15.1.1 PUBLICATION-EC-RECEIVE with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlRouteStatusUpdate PUBLICATIONSTORECEIVE = PublicationsToReceive PUBLICATIONERRORRESPONSEEXPECTED = PublicationErrorResponseExpected PUBLICATIONERRORTYPEEXPECTED = PublicationErrorTypeExpected AUTHENTICATIONCHECK = AuthenticationCheck ALLOWACCESS = AllowAccess Returns: CONTINUEPUBLICATION
Step 15.1.2 IF PublicationErrorResponseExpected is not equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 15.1.2.1 IF TMDD_N16R342_Restrictions_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 15.1.2.1.1 VERIFY that element restrictions exists within each instance of routeStatusMsg.route-status-item
Step 15.1.2.2 IF TMDD_N16R343_Route_Name_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 15.1.2.2.1 VERIFY that element route-name exists within each instance of routeStatusMsg.route-status-item.route-list.route
Step 15.1.2.3 IF TMDD_N16R344_Route_Detour_Status_Flag_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 15.1.2.3.1 VERIFY that element detour-route-in-effect-flag exists within each instance of routeStatusMsg.route-status-item.route-list.route
Step 15.1.2.4 VERIFY that the values within the REQUEST message are correct per the TMDD standard and known operational conditions.

USER-VERIFY-MESSAGE.functionId: The User Verifies the message content

testStep.functionId: Step 15.1.2.5 CONFIGURE: Set OptionalContentVerified to True

Step 15.1.2.6 POSTCONDITION: PUBLICATION-EC-REPLY with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlRouteStatusUpdate OPTIONALCONTENTVERIFIED = OptionalContentVerified PUBLICATIONRESPONSEMESSAGE = PublicationResponseMessage
